Package acsse.csc03a3

Class Block<T>

java.lang.Object
acsse.csc03a3.Block<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of transaction this block holds, allowing for generic transaction types.
public class Block<T> extends Object
Represents a block within a blockchain structure, encapsulating transactions and their collective hash. Each block is linked to its previous block via a hash reference, ensuring integrity across the chain.

    Constructs a new block with the specified previous hash and list of transactions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Block

      public Block(String previousHash, List<Transaction<T>> transactions)
      Constructs a new block with the specified previous hash and list of transactions. Immediately calculates the hash of the new block upon creation.
      Parameters:
      previousHash - The hash of the previous block in the blockchain.
      transactions - The list of transactions to be included in this block.

  • Method Details

    • calculateHash

      public String calculateHash()
      Calculates the hash of the block by combining its previous hash, transactions, and nonce. Uses SHA-256 hashing algorithm to ensure a secure and deterministic hash value.
      Returns:
      The calculated hash as a hexadecimal String.

    • getPreviousHash

      public String getPreviousHash()
      Gets the previous block's hash.
      Returns:
      The previous hash as a String.

    • getTransactions

      public List<Transaction<T>> getTransactions()
      Gets the list of transactions for this block.
      Returns:
      A list of transactions.

    • getHash

      public String getHash()
      Gets the current block's hash.
      Returns:
      The hash as a String.

    • getNonce

      public long getNonce()
      Gets the nonce value for this block.
      Returns:
      The nonce as a long.

    • setNonce

      public void setNonce(long nonce)
      Sets the nonce value for this block and recalculates its hash. This method is typically used in the mining process to achieve a hash with a specific number of leading zeros.
      Parameters:
      nonce - The new nonce value to be set.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the block, including its previous hash, transactions, hash, and nonce.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the block.
